Description: Net-sinker made of dark grey steatite, one corner is broken off but the original size is still recognizable. The object is flat and rectangular in section with a very short fifth side, the edges are very sharp and defined. The ends are rectangular in shape. Two grooves incised at the ends. The surface is well smoothed and polished, many small cuts from shaping the object.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
